isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - DIAGNOSTICS

svcsubsecinfo.para: All 3176B/3406E equipped vehicles have a Yellow "Engine Warning" light located in the instrument cluster. This light communicates engine status.

During normal vehicle startup, turning the key to the ON position causes the Engine Warning Light to come ON as a system test. The light remains ON for about six seconds, then goes OFF. If the Engine Warning Light stays ON after the initial startup, the ECM has detected a problem with the system.
If during vehicle operation, the Engine Warning Light comes ON, that indicates an active fault is present. The light will remain ON, but blink approximately every five seconds for a brief 1/2 second.
